Text:
I have a Grails 2.2.0 project, created the pom.xml for it via '`grails create-pom com.mycompany`'.

pom.xml: http://pastebin.com/AVahZjZF                                                        

Without modifications to the pom.xml, I run '`mvn package`' and getting the error below.

I found this issue being reported earlier in 2.1.x, and it's marked as 'closed', however, I am still getting the issue with Grails 2.2.0.

Related links:

- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9655
- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9652
- http://grails.1312388.n4.nabble.com/grails-maven-plugin-2-1-2-seems-to-be-missing-or-maybe-it-s-not-in-central-yet-td4638614.html

Error / output:

    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [WARNING] The POM for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:jar:2.2.0 is invalid, transitive dependencies (if any) will not be available, enable debug logging for more details
    [ERROR] Invalid extension descriptor for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0: zip file is empty
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.myproject_sport.myproject:myproject:0.1 (/Users/user/Projects/MyProject-Subname/myproject/pom.xml) has 1 error
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException

I have a Grails 2.2.0 project, created the pom.xml for it via '`grails create-pom com.mycompany`'.

pom.xml: http://pastebin.com/AVahZjZF                                                        

Without modifications to the pom.xml, I run '`mvn package`' and getting the error below.

I found this issue being reported earlier in 2.1.x, and it's marked as 'closed', however, I am still getting the issue with Grails 2.2.0.

Related links:

- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9655
- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9652
- http://grails.1312388.n4.nabble.com/grails-maven-plugin-2-1-2-seems-to-be-missing-or-maybe-it-s-not-in-central-yet-td4638614.html

Error / output:

    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [WARNING] The POM for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:jar:2.2.0 is invalid, transitive dependencies (if any) will not be available, enable debug logging for more details
    [ERROR] Invalid extension descriptor for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0: zip file is empty
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.myproject_sport.myproject:myproject:0.1 (/Users/user/Projects/MyProject-Subname/myproject/pom.xml) has 1 error
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.

Folder ~/.m2/repository/grails-maven-plugin:

![enter image description here][1]


My environment:

- Maven 3.0.3
- Grails 2.2.0
- GRAILS_HOME set to my Grails directory
- JDK 1.7.0_11

**Update:**

There seems to be a problem with using JDK 1.7. After cleaning ~/.m2/repository/grails-maven-plugin folder, and running 'mvn package' again, I am now getting a different error as below.
(Where is grails taking the java.version from? Even if I set it to 1.7 in the pom.xml, it would still be looking for com.

In BuildConfig.groovy, I see

    grails.project.target.level = 1.6
    grails.project.source.level = 1.6

(where is this 1.6 coming from, and why is it not 1.7? Sorry, my first Grails project, lots of newbie questions).
but even changing it to:

    grails.project.target.level = 1.7
    grails.project.source.level = 1.7

makes no difference regarding the error I am getting, as below.

    $ java -version
    java version "1.7.0_11"
    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_11-b21)
    Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 23.6-b04, mixed mode)
    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.company:company-projectname:0.1 (/Users/myuser/Projects/com.company.web/pom.xml) has 2 errors
    [ERROR]     Unresolveable build extension: Plugin org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact com.sun:tools:jar:1.6 at specified path /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_11.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bundle/Classes/classes.jar -> [Help 2]
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException
    [ERROR] [Help 2] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/PluginResolutionException

Relevant java tools section in my pom.xml:

    <profiles>
        <profile>
            <id>tools</id>
            <activation>
                <property>
                    <name>java.vendor</name>
                    <value>Sun Microsystems Inc.</value>
                </property>
            </activation>
            <dependencies>
                <dependency>
                    <groupId>com.sun</groupId>
                    <artifactId>tools</artifactId>
                    <version>${java.version}</version>
                    <scope>system</scope>
                    <systemPath>${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar</systemPath>
                </dependency>
            </dependencies>
        </profile>
    </profiles>

  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/kOBRP.png

I have a Grails 2.2.0 project, created the pom.xml for it via '`grails create-pom com.mycompany`'.

pom.xml: http://pastebin.com/AVahZjZF                                                        

Without modifications to the pom.xml, I run '`mvn package`' and getting the error below.

I found this issue being reported earlier in 2.1.x, and it's marked as 'closed', however, I am still getting the issue with Grails 2.2.0.

Related links:

- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9655
- http://jira.grails.org/browse/GRAILS-9652
- http://grails.1312388.n4.nabble.com/grails-maven-plugin-2-1-2-seems-to-be-missing-or-maybe-it-s-not-in-central-yet-td4638614.html

Error / output:

    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [WARNING] The POM for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:jar:2.2.0 is invalid, transitive dependencies (if any) will not be available, enable debug logging for more details
    [ERROR] Invalid extension descriptor for org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0: zip file is empty
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.myproject_sport.myproject:myproject:0.1 (/Users/user/Projects/MyProject-Subname/myproject/pom.xml) has 1 error
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException

Folder ~/.m2/repository/grails-maven-plugin:

![enter image description here][1]


My environment:

- Maven 3.0.3
- Grails 2.2.0
- GRAILS_HOME set to my Grails directory
- JDK 1.7.0_11

**Update:**

There seems to be a problem with using JDK 1.7. After cleaning ~/.m2/repository/grails-maven-plugin folder, and running 'mvn package' again, I am now getting a different error as below.
(Where is grails taking the java.version from? Even if I set it to 1.7 in the pom.xml, it would still be looking for com.

In BuildConfig.groovy, I see

    grails.project.target.level = 1.6
    grails.project.source.level = 1.6

(where is this 1.6 coming from, and why is it not 1.7? Sorry, my first Grails project, lots of newbie questions).
but even changing it to:

    grails.project.target.level = 1.7
    grails.project.source.level = 1.7

makes no difference regarding the error I am getting, as below.

    $ java -version
    java version "1.7.0_11"
    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_11-b21)
    Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 23.6-b04, mixed mode)
    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.company:company-projectname:0.1 (/Users/myuser/Projects/com.company.web/pom.xml) has 2 errors
    [ERROR]     Unresolveable build extension: Plugin org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact com.sun:tools:jar:1.6 at specified path /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_11.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bundle/Classes/classes.jar -> [Help 2]
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException
    [ERROR] [Help 2] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/PluginResolutionException

Relevant java tools section in my pom.xml:

    <profiles>
        <profile>
            <id>tools</id>
            <activation>
                <property>
                    <name>java.vendor</name>
                    <value>Sun Microsystems Inc.</value>
                </property>
            </activation>
            <dependencies>
                <dependency>
                    <groupId>com.sun</groupId>
                    <artifactId>tools</artifactId>
                    <version>${java.version}</version>
                    <scope>system</scope>
                    <systemPath>${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar</systemPath>
                </dependency>
            </dependencies>
        </profile>
    </profiles>

Switching to JDK 1.6 works, but how can I get the project running with 1.7 ? Changing 

    grails.project.target.level = 1.7
    grails.project.source.level = 1.7

in BuildConfig.groovy doesn't seem to be sufficient.

Thanks for your patience (my first Grails project).


  [1]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/kOBRP.png

My environment:

- Maven 3.0.3
- Grails 2.2.0
- GRAILS_HOME set to my Grails directory
- JDK 1.7.0_11

**Update:**

There seems to be a problem with using JDK 1.7. After cleaning ~/.m2/repository/grails-maven-plugin folder, and running 'mvn package' again, I am now getting a different error as below.
(Where is grails taking the java.version from? Even if I set it to 1.7 in the pom.xml and BuildConfig.groovy, it would still be looking for com.sun:tools:jar:1.6).

In BuildConfig.groovy, I see

    grails.project.target.level = 1.6
    grails.project.source.level = 1.6

(where is this 1.6 coming from, and why is it not 1.7? Sorry, my first Grails project, lots of newbie questions).
but even changing it to:

    grails.project.target.level = 1.7
    grails.project.source.level = 1.7

makes no difference regarding the error I am getting, as below.

    $ java -version
    java version "1.7.0_11"
    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_11-b21)
    Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 23.6-b04, mixed mode)
    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.company:company-projectname:0.1 (/Users/myuser/Projects/com.company.web/pom.xml) has 2 errors
    [ERROR]     Unresolveable build extension: Plugin org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact com.sun:tools:jar:1.6 at specified path /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_11.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bundle/Classes/classes.jar -> [Help 2]
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException
    [ERROR] [Help 2] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/PluginResolutionException

Relevant java tools section in my pom.xml:

    <profiles>
        <profile>
            <id>tools</id>
            <activation>
                <property>
                    <name>java.vendor</name>
                    <value>Sun Microsystems Inc.</value>
                </property>
            </activation>
            <dependencies>
                <dependency>
                    <groupId>com.sun</groupId>
                    <artifactId>tools</artifactId>
                    <version>${java.version}</version>
                    <scope>system</scope>
                    <systemPath>${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar</systemPath>
                </dependency>
            </dependencies>
        </profile>
    </profiles>

Switching to JDK 1.6 works, but how can I get the project running with 1.7 ? Changing 

    grails.project.target.level = 1.7
    grails.project.source.level = 1.7

in BuildConfig.groovy doesn't seem to be sufficient.

Thanks for your patience (my first Grails project).

I see that the java version is set to 1.6 in grails-maven-plugin-2.2.0.pom, thus my question now: how to make the maven build for my grails project work with JDK 1.7? How to pass the correct source and target level through my project and still being able to use JDK 1.7?

The error I am getting:

    $ java -version
    java version "1.7.0_11"
    Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_11-b21)
    Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 23.6-b04, mixed mode)
    $ mvn package
    [INFO] Scanning for projects...
    [ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]
    [ERROR]   
    [ERROR]   The project com.company:company-projectname:0.1 (/Users/myuser/Projects/com.company.web/pom.xml) has 2 errors
    [ERROR]     Unresolveable build extension: Plugin org.grails:grails-maven-plugin:2.2.0 or one of its dependencies could not be resolved: Could not find artifact com.sun:tools:jar:1.6 at specified path /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_11.jdk/Contents/Home/jre/bundle/Classes/classes.jar -> [Help 2]
    [ERROR]     Unknown packaging: grails-app @ line 8, column 16
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.
    [ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.
    [ERROR] 
    [ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:
    [ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException
    [ERROR] [Help 2] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/PluginResolutionException

Relevant java tools section in my pom.xml:

    <profiles>
        <profile>
            <id>tools</id>
            <activation>
                <property>
                    <name>java.vendor</name>
                    <value>Sun Microsystems Inc.</value>
                </property>
            </activation>
            <dependencies>
                <dependency>
                    <groupId>com.sun</groupId>
                    <artifactId>tools</artifactId>
                    <version>${java.version}</version>
                    <scope>system</scope>
                    <systemPath>${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar</systemPath>
                </dependency>
            </dependencies>
        </profile>
    </profiles>

Switching to JDK 1.6 works, but how can I get the project running with JDK 1.7 and just passing the correct source/target level in some way?

Thanks for your patience (my first Grails project).
